title: Game Of Thrones star Kit Harington wants Sophie Turner to ‘shush’
text:
Oh, that Sophie is a jokester

Kit Harington is done with Sophie Turner dishing secrets from the Game Of Thrones (GOT) set.

The 32-year-old actor, who played Jon Snow in the HBO fantasy series, was apparently called out by Sophie (Sansa Stark) over the amount of time he spent in the make-up trailer during the show.

With the epic series now done and dusted, the stories between the actors are still coming through thick and fast and Kit is keen for it to stop.

Sophie was known for ribbing her on-screen sort-of brother about the considerable amount of time he spent perfecting Jon’s curls, and Kit has some thoughts on that, as he was asked about Sophie’s quips during ACE Comic Con this weekend.

‘Sophie Turner needs to just shush every now and then,’ 32-year-old Kit joked.

The pair played siblings (Picture: HBO)

Cheeky comments aside, the star opened up on the bond he shares with on-screen sisters Sophie and Maisie Williams (Arya Stark), as well as brother Isaac Hempstead Wright (who played Bran Stark).

‘I love that girl to my very bones. The thing about Sophie, Maisie, Issac and me is that we were together for so long,’ he said.

‘Richard [Madden] was definitely in that too. We became like actual siblings, we would literally fight each other. We have a very sibling relationship.’

Kit appeared at Comic Con (Picture: Getty Images)

Fans are still coming to terms with the fact the show isn’t making a return in its current form (we’ve got a prequel coming up, so we’ve got something to get keen about), and also they still feel a little robbed by a supposed lacklustre ending.

Game Of Thrones came to a controversial end in May this year, sparking fan petitions which called for the show’s final episodes to be remade.

Even last week poor Sophie got a taste of her own trolling medicine when she became subject to GOT ribbing while attending an NFL match after showing her allegiance to the Chicago Bears.

The 23-year-old actress turned up for the NFL match on 6 October in London which saw the Chicago Bears face the Oakland Raiders.

She made her presence known by posting a video on the Chicago Bears social channels, saying: ‘To all the Bears fans, I’m here, I’m repping you, shout-out Chicago Bears.’

Unfortunately for Sophie, the Bears lost out to the Oakland Raiders 24-21, which prompted some casual shade from the winning team’s social channels.

Sharing Sophie’s video, the Raiders tweeted: ‘That game had a better finish than Thrones.’
